data.enText: the act of working with another person or group of people to create or produce sth
She wrote the book in collaboration with one of her students.
data.chText: 她和她的一个学生合写了这本书。

data.enText: The government worked in close collaboration with teachers on the new curriculum.
data.chText: 政府和教师就新的课程进行了紧密协作。

data.enText: collaboration between the teachers and the government
It was a collaboration that produced extremely useful results.
data.chText: 这是一次带来极其有益的成果的合作。

data.enText: a piece of work produced by two or more people or groups of people working together
the act of helping the enemy during a war when they have taken control of your country

example: they worked either in collaboration or independently

tr: act of cooperating traitorously with an enemy that is occupying your country

example.ex: There is substantial collaboration with neighbouring departments...
example.tran: 与相邻的一些部门有大量的合作。

example.ex: Close collaboration between the Bank and the Fund is not merely desirable, it is essential.
example.tran: 银行与基金会的紧密合作不仅可取，而且必不可少。

example.ex: Drummond was working on a book in collaboration with Zodiac Mindwarp.
example.tran: 德拉蒙德正与“黄道神游”（本名马克·曼宁）合作撰写一本书。

gramarinfo.label: oft N <l>with</l> n, N <l>between</l> pl-n, <l>in</l> N

value.def: Collaboration is the act of working together to produce a piece of work, especially a book or some research.
value.tran: (尤指在著书或研究方面的)合作，协作

example.ex: He was also a writer of beautiful stories, some of which are collaborations with his fiancee.
example.tran: 他还写了一些美妙的故事，其中有些是和他的未婚妻合著的。

value.def: A collaboration is a piece of work that has been produced as the result of people or groups working together.

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>with</l> n

value.def: Collaboration is the act of helping an enemy who is occupying your country during a war.

trans: 与……合作；与合作；合作；与…合作；会同
协作图；合作图；协作框图；配合图；协同图
